file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 21-23-03-04 - CONFIG-2 - GASPER FAN - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL GASPER FAN - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-135 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the gasper fan. B. The gasper fan is installed in the center fuselage III, under the passenger cabin floor. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ACFT MODEL(S) 21-23-03-000-802-A GASPER FAN - REMOVAL EMB-135 ACFT MODEL(S) 21-23-03-400-802-A GASPER FAN - INSTALLATION EMB-135 EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General CONFIG-2 21-23-03 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 21-23-03-000-802-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-135 2. GASPER FAN - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to remove the gasper fan. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 - AMM TASK 53-01-02-000-802-A/400 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 251 251HF Passenger cabin floor D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Under the passenger cabin floor I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-016-A (1) On the overhead circuit breaker panel, open the GASPER FAN circuit breaker and attach a DO-NOT-CLOSE tag to it. (2) Remove the floor access panel 251HF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 and AMM TASK 53-01-02-000-802-A/400). (3) For Velcro-attached insulation, loosen the Velcro fasteners from the insulation blanket of the gasper fan. For adhesive tape-attached insulation, remove the tape from the insulating blanket of the gasper fan. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 CONFIG-2 21-23-03 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-009-A (1) Disconnect the electrical connector (4). (2) Remove the clamps (1) that attach the gasper fan in the inlet and outlet mufflers. (3) Cut the lockwire and loosen the clamps (2) that attach the fan to its support. (4) Remove the gasper fan (3). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 CONFIG-2 21-23-03 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-135 Gasper Fan - Removal/Installation Figure 401 A ZONES 161 162 DET. A B INSULATION BLANKET (REF.) 4. ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR LOCK WIRE LOCK WIRE 2. CLAMP 2. CLAMP MUFFLER (REF.) 1. CLAMP MUFFLER (REF.) 3. GASPER FAN 1. CLAMP DET. B 145AMM210238.MCE A EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 CONFIG-2 21-23-03 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 21-23-03-400-802-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-135 3. GASPER FAN - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to install the gasper fan. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 - CONDITIONED AIR DISTRIBUTION SYSTEM - OP- AMM TASK 21-20-00-700-801-A/500 ERATIONAL CHECK AMM TASK 28-41-00-200-801-A/600 - AMM TASK 53-01-02-400-802-A/400 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 251 251HF Passenger cabin floor D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) MS20995C20 Safety wire AR KB42/75 Adhesive Tape AR G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Under the passenger cabin floor I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-017-A (1) Make sure that the GASPER FAN circuit breaker, on the overhead circuit breaker panel, is open and with a DO-NOT-CLOSE tag attached to it. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 CONFIG-2 21-23-03 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-009-A (1) Put the gasper fan (3) in the installation position. (2) Install the fan to its support through the clamps (2). (3) Lockwire the clamps (2). (4) Install the clamps (1) that attach the fan to the inlet and outlet mufflers. (5) Connect the electrical connector (4). K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-009-A (1) Do the AMM TASK 21-20-00-700-801-A/500. (2) For Velcro-attachable insulation, attach the Velcro fastener of the insulating blanket of the gasper fan. For adhesive tape-attachable insulation, put the insulating blanket in position and apply several pieces of KB42/75 tape to hold the ends of the blanket together. (3) Do an inspection on the fuel quantity indication harness (AMM TASK 28-41-00-200-801-A/600). NOTE: The inspection of fuel quantity indication harness is a part of Critical Design Configuration Control Limitations (CDCCL) in the Airworthiness Limitations (Section 6) of the Maintenance Review Board Report (MRB). (4) Install the floor access panel 251HF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 and AMM TASK 53-01-02-400-802-A/400). (5) On the overhead circuit breaker panel, remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from the GASPER FAN circuit breaker and close it.
